title: Applying Pedagogy of Experiential Complexity for Smart Learning (PECSL) to Design Learning Activities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pedagogical theory and experience in utilizing digital tools
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service and in-service teachers focusing on designing smart learning environments in science, including practical activities reflecting urban hyper-locality.

learning_goals: The PECSL 4-stage model (Plan-Design-Implement-Evaluate) can be applied to design smart learning activities in the science domain.
Learning scenarios based on experiential complexity can be developed using mobile apps and digital tools.
Educational activities in complex urban environments can be planned by integrating learner-centered design principles with pedagogical considerations.
The effectiveness of designed smart learning activities can be analyzed, and improvement plans can be proposed through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
